# gitlab_project_secure_file (Data Source)

The `gitlab_project_secure_file` data source allows the contents of a secure file to be retrieved by either Name or ID.

**Upstream API**: [GitLab REST API docs](https://docs.gitlab.com/api/secure_files/)

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "gitlab_project_secure_file" "by_id" {
  project        = "123"
  secure_file_id = 123
}

data "gitlab_project_secure_file" "by_name" {
  project = "123"
  name    = "secret.pem"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `project` (String) The ID or full path of the project the secure file resides.

### Optional

- `name` (String) The name for the secure file, unique per project
- `secure_file_id` (Number) The id of the secure file in gitlab

### Read-Only

- `checksum` (String) The checksum of the file
- `checksum_algorithm` (String) The checksum algorithm used
- `content` (String) The contents of the secure file
- `created_at` (String) The time the secure file was uploaded
- `expires_at` (String) The time the secure file will expire
- `id` (String) The ID of this data source. In the format `<project:id>`
- `metadata` (Attributes) metadata returned by the gitlab api about the secure file (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--metadata))

<a id="nestedatt--metadata"></a>
### Nested Schema for `metadata`

Read-Only:

- `expires_at` (String) Certificate expiration date
- `id` (String) Certificate ID
- `issuer` (Attributes) Certificate issuer information (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--metadata--issuer))
- `subject` (Attributes) Certificate subject information (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--metadata--subject))

<a id="nestedatt--metadata--issuer"></a>
### Nested Schema for `metadata.issuer`

Read-Only:

- `c` (String) Country
- `cn` (String) Common Name
- `o` (String) Organization
- `ou` (String) Organizational Unit


<a id="nestedatt--metadata--subject"></a>
### Nested Schema for `metadata.subject`

Read-Only:

- `c` (String) Country
- `cn` (String) Common Name
- `o` (String) Organization
- `ou` (String) Organizational Unit
- `uid` (String) User ID
